oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Magnetic properties of ternary gallides of type RNi4Ga (R=rare earths)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JOSHI, DEVANG A
TOMY, CV
RANA, DS
NAGARAJAN, R
MALIK, SK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ferromagnetism
gallium compounds
magnetic properties
magnetization
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The magnetic properties of RNi4Ga (R = La, Pr, Nd, Sm, Gd, Tb, Dy, Ho, Er, Tm and Lu) compounds have been investigated. These compounds form in a hexagonal CaCu5 type structure with a space group P6/mmm. Compounds with the magnetic rare earths, R = Nd, Sm, Gd, Tb, Dy, Ho, Er and Tm, undergo a ferromagnetic transition at 5, 17, 20, 19, 12, 3.5, 8 and 6.5 K, respectively. The transition temperatures are smaller compared to their respective parent compounds RNi5. PrNi4Ga is paramagnetic down to 2 K. LaNi4Ga and LuNi4Ga are Pauli paramagnets. All the compounds show thermomagnetic irreversibility in the magnetically ordered state except GdNi4Ga.
